plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub valued for its large, showy flowers that bloom in winter, often used as ornamental plants in gardens and parks.
plants.location: Temperate regions of East Asia, cultivated worldwide in mild climates
plants.funFact: Camellias are among the few plants that bloom during the cold winter months, providing important nectar for pollinators in scarce conditions.

plants.name: Cistus (Rockrose)
plants.description: A genus of drought-tolerant shrubs with papery flowers that open in the cooler months, commonly found in Mediterranean climates.
plants.funFact: Rockroses produce sticky resins historically used in varnishes and perfumes.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial evergreen plant with white flowers often blooming in the depths of winter, traditionally associated with Christmas time.
plants.location: Mountainous regions of Europe, cultivated in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose; it has been used medicinally in traditional European herbal medicine.

plants.name: Acacia dealbata
plants.description: A fast-growing tree known for its bright yellow, fragrant flower clusters that bloom in late winter to early spring.
plants.location: Australia, also widely cultivated in Mediterranean climates
plants.funFact: Silver Wattle flowers are often used in floral arrangements during winter due to their cheerful color and fragrance.
